definition: to ride to take up an official appointment (idiom); to take on a job with alacrity/to undertake a task
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)

sentences.english: He came to office only six weeks ago, offering hope.
sentences.chinese: 6周以前，他深孚衆望，走馬上任。

sentences.english: The elections were over and the first native Governor was inaugurated.
sentences.chinese: 選舉結束，第一個在當地土生土長的州長走馬上任了。

sentences.english: Does your weight affect chances of you landing that next job?
sentences.chinese: 體重會不會影響你能否在一個新的領域裏走馬上任呢？

sentences.english: And my only thing need to do is to go to take up my office.
sentences.chinese: 而我唯一要做的事情就是走馬上任了。

sentences.english: Mr. President, I’m eager to assume this new position.
sentences.chinese: 總統先生，我熱切地盼望走馬上任。

definition: lit. to fix the tone with a single hammer blow/fig. to make the final decision
Zhou Ji (1781-1839), Qing writer and poet
help to the needy/emergency relief/charity/to give to poorer relative/(also 賙濟|赒济)
Taichung or Taizhong county in central Taiwan
organizing committee/abbr. to 組委|组委

pinyin: Guo2 ji4 Ao4 lin2 pi3 ke4 Wei3 yuan2 hui4
